reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was clean and in a good location for those that have rental cars. When we checked in we were told our room was in the Bear Lodge which is located on the same property. I’m not sure if we were getting what we paid for though because they said the rooms were larger in the Wedgewood part of the resort and that is what we thought we were getting. Please see my pictures of the room. I would definitely call to confirm where you will be staying to guarantee which room you are getting.
reviews.title: Average clean hotel

likes.disliked: — We did not get the room we were promised

reviews.title: "Next to Nature" great stay at the Wedgewood Resort
reviews.text: Sorry non cruise people about the start of the review if its not relavant to you but there are a lot of cruise people staying here.

I have never even been to such a run down apartment much less have to stay in such a mess of a place. The "resort" is old apartments that were built for oil refinery workers in the 70's. When I got there I quickly learned that the only activity at this place was hauling my luggage up the 3 flights of stairs no elevators and they don't tell you this in advance. Once inside my room it only gets worse. The room is dated with the dark wood paneling and the mustard yellow kitchen. The AC only works in the bedroom area so if its hot plan on spending a lot of time crammed into the place that is big as a closet. The sheets felt like sandpaper and the bed was nothing more than a mattress and box spring on a frame. When I stayed there the power went out 2x and the room had musty smell. And the curtains had what looked like bullet holes in them. I travel a lot on business and understand that in certain parts of the world there is not much choices of decent hotels. But this place takes the cake at 229 a nite they really made me desire to sleep in a pop up camper over this "resort". I was scheduled for a week but checks out after 2 nites.
reviews.title: If by resort you mean crappy 70's apartment then yeah....

likes.liked: — I got to leave after only 2 days
likes.disliked: — the stairs with my 100 lbs of luggage, the rooms were nasty

reviews.title: All the Comforts of Home
reviews.text: After having stayed at the Wedgewood Resort for four nights, we have to say that it certainly offered us all of the comforts of home. The suite was very clean and roomy with a well-appointed full sized kitchen, offering the option of cooking when we tired of eating out all of the time. We enjoyed the prospect of coming home to our own relaxing suite for

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: "down time" after each day of Alaska adventures. It was always cleaned very well and in a timely manner each day. At check-in and check-out the staff was pleasant and quite accommodating. The breakfast buffet offered a large variety of delicious items, and we certainly didn't come away hungry! We will definitely recommend the Wedgewood Resort to any of our friends who are planning a trip to Fairbanks. It is truly one of Alaska's hidden treasures.

reviews.title: Old and musty
reviews.text: (Oh, we almost forgot. When it came to blocking out the "midnight sun" for sleeping at night, the curtains were the best!)

reviews.title: Not up the Princess Standards
reviews.text: This was my last stop on a 14-day Princess CruiseTour. It was the worst place that we stayed. The rooms were bare, the location remote...there was little we could walk to. It was not up to the high quality of the rest of our Princess Cruise and stay in Denali.

We stayed here for five nights (actually four because we left most of our stuff here one night while we were up at Coldfoot and Wiseman) on our driving trek from New York to Alaska. This is a multi apartment building complex. There appeared to be three floors to the various buildings. We were in a first floor apartment in the Harding Building, near the entrance to the building. Our room did look dated but it didn't matter to us. It was clean. There was a living room, two bedrooms, bathroom, and small walk-through kitchen. The couch opened up to a bed.
reviews.title: Clean apartment hotel

likes.disliked: — Wireless Internet didn't reach our room

reviews.text: You are on your own for breakfast (there is no continental breakfast). We like to eat in on our trips. We bought foodstuffs at the local Fred Meyers and Safeway.
